column4: hi, my trackpad isn't detected on my Dell XPS 15z, do you've a solution ?
i'm not convincted by ubuntu server, i prefere debian or centOS on my servers but it's not bad ;)
yes, I used to use both of those, but lately I find that ubuntu being used as a server isn't really so bad, and a lot of the depenency problems I used to run into aren't as frequent.

this is a development server, so we need to be able to install new packages easily without dependency worries... but for single purpose servers I agree something like centos/debian with a locked down set of dependencies specific for the app makes a lot of sense.
anyway - my problem is that, I did a dist-upgrade from 10.04 to 11.10 and now it seems udev and perl-base are having problems.
yes ubuntu on a prod server, it's a suicide though :D
but, who can help me with my not detected trackpad ?
i managed to get apt and dpkg to stop complaining about them by downloading the .deb's and doing a --reinstall
but when i run perlapps libperl segfaults.
and udev creates some dmesg errors
starts off fine, but at some point I get errors like: /bin/setupcon: 447: cannot open /dev/tty2: No such device
probably because udev isn't properly initializing the dev filesystem during boot
